abstract: The Exelon Corporation said late Sunday that it had offered to buy NRG Energy for $6.2 billion.
snippet: The Exelon Corporation said late Sunday that it had offered to buy NRG Energy for $6.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Exelon Corporation, the Chicago-based utility, said late Sunday that it had offered to buy NRG Energy, a power generator based in Princeton, N.J., for $6.2 billion.

headline.main: Nuclear Power Giant Bids for Rival
headline.print_headline: Nuclear Power Giant Bids for Rival

abstract: The Exelon Corporation, the Chicago-based utility, said late Sunday that it had offered to buy NRG Energy, a power generator based in Princeton, N.J., for $6.2 billion, The New York Times’s Matthew L. Wald reported.
lead_paragraph: The Exelon Corporation, the Chicago-based utility, said late Sunday that it had offered to buy NRG Energy, a power generator based in Princeton, N.J., for $6.2 billion, The New York Times’s Matthew L. Wald reported.

headline.main: Exelon Makes $6.2 Billion Bid for NRG

abstract: The Exelon Corporation says its unsolicited bid to buy NRG Energy would create the largest power company in the country, in terms of assets, market capitalization and generation capacity.
snippet: The Exelon Corporation says its unsolicited bid to buy NRG Energy would create the largest power company in the country, in terms of assets, market capitalization and generation capacity.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Exelon Corporation’s unsolicited bid to buy NRG Energy, a power generator based in Princeton, N.J., would create the largest power company in the country, in terms of assets, market capitalization and generation capacity, and would benefit shareholders of both companies, Exelon said on Monday.

headline.main: Exelon’s $6.2 Billion Bid for NRG Would Create Largest Power Utility in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Exelon’s $6.2 Billion Bid for NRG Would Create Largest Power Utility in U.S.

abstract: The Exelon Corporation threatened Monday to make a hostile bid for NRG Energy if its unsolicited $6.2 billion takeover offer is rejected, Reuters reports.
lead_paragraph: The Exelon Corporation threatened Monday to make a hostile bid for NRG Energy if its unsolicited $6.2 billion takeover offer is rejected, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Exelon May Pursue Hostile Bid for NRG if Needed
